required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Determining Normal Range for Free Light Chains in Serum Among Twins
clinical_study.official_title: Normal Range Study for Free Light Chains in Blood Among Identical or Fraternal Twins

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this study is to recruit healthy adult identical and fraternal twins for the collection of one teaspoon of blood to be sent to the Clinical Lab at San Francisco General Hospital. The serum will be tested to determine the reference range for free light chains.

detailed_description.textblock: Serum free light chains are used to assist in the diagnosis of multiple myeloma. The test measures kappa (K) and lambda (L) chains, and the calculation of the ratio of kappa to lambda (K/L). Previous studies have shown that the K/L ratio does not change over time (1 year). The hypothesis of this study is that healthy twins will have a K/L ratio that are close to each other in value, suggesting that this ratio is geneticallyl linked.

study_design_info.masking_description: The participant will not be given the results of the free light chain result

primary_outcome.time_frame: One month after the completion of the enrollment
primary_outcome.description: Determination of the normal range for free light chains

arm_group.description: Free light chains of twins compared to non-twin siblings

intervention.description: Blood samples will be collected and analyzed

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy subjects 18-80 years.
- Must be an identical or fraternal twin (both must be recruited)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Symptoms suggestive of multiple myeloma (e.g., renal insufficiency, anemia, bone pain) -

results_reference.citation: Braga F, Infusino I, Dolci A, Panteghini M. Biological variation of free light chains in serum. Clin Chim Acta. 2013 Jan 16;415:10-1. doi: 10.1016/j.cca.2012.09.008. Epub 2012 Sep 11.

Katzmann JA, Clark RJ, Abraham RS, Bryant S, Lymp JF, Bradwell AR, Kyle RA. Serum reference intervals and diagnostic ranges for free kappa and free lambda immunoglobulin light chains: relative sensitivity for detection of monoclonal light chains. Clin Chem. 2002 Sep;48(9):1437-44.

patient_data.ipd_description: Participants and other researchers will not have access to data.
